content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here's a function named `keep_only_names` that accomplishes the described task. The function uses the `filter!` function to iterate over the input words and keep only those that start with a capital letter:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter!(word -> startswith(word, 'A') || startswith(word, 'B') ||
                        startswith(word, 'C') || startswith(word, 'D') ||
                        startswith(word, 'E') || startswith(word, 'F') ||
                        startswith(word, 'G') || startswith(word, 'H') ||
                        startswith(word, 'I') || startswith(word, 'J') ||
                        startswith(word, 'K') || startswith(word, 'L') ||
                        startswith(word, 'M') || startswith(word, 'N') ||
                        startswith(word, 'O') || startswith(word, 'P') ||
                        startswith(word, 'Q') || startswith(word, 'R') ||
                        startswith(word, 'S') || startswith(word, 'T') ||
                        startswith(word, 'U') || startswith(word, 'V') ||
                        startswith(word, 'W') || startswith(word, 'X') ||
                        startswith(word, 'Y') || startswith(word, 'Z'),
                    words)
end
```

The `startswith(word, 'A')` expression checks if the word begins with the letter A (or any capital letter). The `filter!` function applies this test to each word in the input collection and returns a new collection containing only the elements for which the function returns `true`.
